articles.headline: For Many Chinese Men, No Deed Means No Dates
articles.snippet: Amid a real estate boom, men are finding themselves lovelorn as women hold out for a mate with property.
articles.abstract: Amid a real estate boom, men are finding themselves lovelorn as women hold out for a mate with property.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — In the realm of eligible bachelors, Wang Lin has a lot to recommend him. A 28-year-old college-educated insurance salesman, Mr. Wang has a flawless set of white teeth, a tolerable karaoke voice and a three-year-old Nissan with furry blue seat covers.

articles.headline: Congress Passes Budget Bill, but Some in G.O.P. Balk
articles.snippet: The House and Senate passed the compromise legislation to finance the federal government, with 59 House Republicans breaking ranks to vote against the deal.
articles.abstract: The House and Senate passed the compromise legislation to finance the federal government, with 59 House Republicans breaking ranks to vote against the deal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congress voted Thursday to keep the government financed through September, putting an end to a raucous first skirmish in this year’s showdown between Democrats and Republicans over federal spending while presaging bigger ones to come.

articles.headline: Pain of British Fiscal Cuts Could Inform U.S. Debate
articles.snippet: A year into Britain’s controversial austerity plan, retail sales have had the sharpest monthly plunge in 15 years and real household income is expected to fall 2 percent this year.
articles.abstract: A year into Britain’s controversial austerity plan, retail sales have had the sharpest monthly plunge in 15 years and real household income is expected to fall 2 percent this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In the United States, the debate over how to cut the long-term budget deficit is just getting under way.

articles.headline: Resentment Is Rising In Euro Zone
articles.snippet: It is hard to see how the euro zone can be undone, but it is even harder to see how it will prosper.
articles.abstract: It is hard to see how the euro zone can be undone, but it is even harder to see how it will prosper.
articles.lead_paragraph: The real Golden Rule, it has been said, goes like this: He who has the gold, rules.

articles.headline: U.S. Groups Helped Nurture Arab Uprisings
articles.snippet: A small core of American groups played a bigger role in promoting democracy in Arab states than was previously known.
articles.abstract: A small core of American groups played a bigger role in promoting democracy in Arab states than was previously known.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even as the United States poured billions of dollars into foreign military programs and anti-terrorism campaigns, a small core of American government-financed organizations were promoting democracy in authoritarian Arab states.

articles.headline: This Lady Liberty Is a Las Vegas Teenager
articles.snippet: The Postal Service’s new Statue of Liberty stamp is accidentally based on the replica at the New York-New York casino in Las Vegas.
articles.abstract: The Postal Service’s new Statue of Liberty stamp is accidentally based on the replica at the New York-New York casino in Las Vegas.
articles.lead_paragraph: As if further proof were needed that New York is not the center of the universe.
articles.byline: By Kim Severson and Matthew Healey

articles.headline: Pressure Grows to Unwind CVS Merger
articles.snippet: The consumer groups contend the merged drugstore chain and pharmacy benefit manager are anti-competitive.
articles.abstract: The consumer groups contend the merged drugstore chain and pharmacy benefit manager are anti-competitive.
articles.lead_paragraph: CVS Caremark is coming under increasing pressure from consumer groups and shareholders to split up, at the same time that federal and state regulators are looking into accusations of anticompetitive behavior by the merged company.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson and Natasha Singer

articles.headline: Price of Tomatoes Has a Lot to Do With These Thefts
articles.snippet: The authorities say the thefts were committed by people familiar with the produce trucking business who waited for the price to rise.
articles.abstract: The authorities say the thefts were committed by people familiar with the produce trucking business who waited for the price to rise.
articles.lead_paragraph: The high price of produce, especially for tomatoes after the deep winter freezes, has attracted more than heightened attention from consumers. A ring of sophisticated vegetable bandits was watching, too.

articles.headline: The Business Market Plays Cloud Computing Catch-Up
articles.snippet: There are signs that companies like I.B.M. and their establishment customers now want remote information services to be a bigger part of what they offer.
articles.abstract: There are signs that companies like I.B.M. and their establishment customers now want remote information services to be a bigger part of what they offer.
articles.lead_paragraph: The big spenders on technology are businesses and government agencies. They buy about 75 percent of the computing goods and services sold worldwide. Yet it is increasingly evident they are not driving the new ideas, excitement and powerhouse technology companies in ascent these days.

articles.headline: Gaza Killing of Italian Activist Deals a Blow to Hamas
articles.snippet: Vittorio Arrigoni apparently died at the hands of a fringe group of Palestinians, raising embarrassing questions for Hamas about the security it says it has restored in Gaza.
articles.abstract: Vittorio Arrigoni apparently died at the hands of a fringe group of Palestinians, raising embarrassing questions for Hamas about the security it says it has restored in Gaza.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA — For Vittorio Arrigoni, an Italian pro-Palestinian activist who friends said fought peacefully for justice, the end was as violent as it was incongruous.
articles.byline: By Fares Akram and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: At Mexico Morgue, Families of Missing Seek Clues
articles.snippet: For two weeks now, the discoveries of mass graves have hardened the perception that parts of northern Mexico have been lost to criminal gangs.
articles.abstract: For two weeks now, the discoveries of mass graves have hardened the perception that parts of northern Mexico have been lost to criminal gangs.
articles.lead_paragraph: MATAMOROS, Mexico — The last time anybody heard from Josué Román García was last August, after he and his older brother stopped for dinner in an isolated town about 90 miles south of the Texas border. His final known words went out via text message, from inside the trunk of a car.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Malkin and Damien Cave
